messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] MA court case (was Re: 2219 Death fromReligion)
messages.msgSnippet: ** And this *really* isn t the forum to discuss it in because I m *way* underinformed for a discussion. (Besides being way too state specific to be useful to
messages.messageBody:
**

And this *really* isn't the forum to discuss it in because I'm *way*
underinformed for a discussion. (Besides being way too state specific to be
useful to unschoolers in general.) If anyone has questions the place to go
is http://groups.yahoo.com/group/MAhomeschoolers/**

Right! This isn't the right forum.

The details of the political fights to maintain homeschooling rights are
different in each of the 50 US states. With 800 people on list we
probably have people from every state in the US, and I know we also have
people from other countries around the globe. Discussing the political
situations in every state would be overwhelming! Although an occasional
discussion of local political issues MIGHT be of general interest, the
details of each individual battle are probably NOT of interest to 49 out
of every 50 people on the list.

Discussions of state politics are best suited to STATE homeschooling
lists and lists that specialize in political issues.

Betsy
